reactor.fn.timer

Interface Timer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventTimer, HashWheelTimer

    public interface Timer
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancel this timer by interrupting the task thread.
      long getResolution()
      Get the resolution of this tTimer.
      Pausable schedule(Consumer<Long> consumer, long period, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Schedule a recurring task.
      Pausable schedule(Consumer<Long> consumer, long period, TimeUnit timeUnit, long delayInMilliseconds)
      Schedule a recurring task.
      Pausable submit(Consumer<Long> consumer)
      Submit a task for arbitrary execution after the delay of this timer's resolution.
      Pausable submit(Consumer<Long> consumer, long delay, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Submit a task for arbitrary execution after the given time delay.

    • Method Detail

      • getResolution

        long getResolution()
        Get the resolution of this tTimer.
        Returns:
        the resolution in milliseconds

      • schedule

        Pausable schedule(Consumer<Long> consumer,
                  long period,
                  TimeUnit timeUnit,
                  long delayInMilliseconds)
        Schedule a recurring task. The given Consumer will be invoked once every N time units after the given delay.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer to invoke each period
        period - the amount of time that should elapse between invocations of the given Consumer
        timeUnit - the unit of time the period is to be measured in
        delayInMilliseconds - a number of milliseconds in which to delay any execution of the given Consumer
        Returns:
        a Pausable that can be used to cancel, pause or resume the given task.

      • schedule

        Pausable schedule(Consumer<Long> consumer,
                  long period,
                  TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Schedule a recurring task. The given Consumer will be invoked immediately, as well as once every N time units.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer to invoke each period
        period - the amount of time that should elapse between invocations of the given Consumer
        timeUnit - the unit of time the period is to be measured in
        Returns:
        a Pausable that can be used to cancel, pause or resume the given task.
        See Also:
        schedule(reactor.fn.Consumer, long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit, long)

      • submit

        Pausable submit(Consumer<Long> consumer,
                long delay,
                TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Submit a task for arbitrary execution after the given time delay.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer to invoke
        delay - the amount of time that should elapse before invocations of the given Consumer
        timeUnit - the unit of time the period is to be measured in
        Returns:
        a Pausable that can be used to cancel, pause or resume the given task.

      • submit

        Pausable submit(Consumer<Long> consumer)
        Submit a task for arbitrary execution after the delay of this timer's resolution.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer to invoke
        Returns:
        this

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancel this timer by interrupting the task thread. No more tasks can be submitted to this timer after cancellation.
